location: Durham, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
I bought this gun from a skeet shooter who was moving to an O/U and then I shot a ton of skeet with it. As far as I know it's never been in the field, so the marks are very minor. It has been perfect for me. I just don't have time to shoot anymore - who knew three kids could take so much time?

I am kind of shocked by the prices on the Beretta Urika AL391 - people seem to be getting upwards of $900 for them.
ex: http://www.gunbroker.com/Auction/ViewItem.aspx?Item=233756487

This is a NIB example for $925, but the wood is not nearly as nice as mine: http://www.gunbroker.com/Auction/ViewItem.aspx?Item=234320289

Mine includes the standard chokes but not my extra Briley chokes - no idea why my turkey chokes are in that picture. It does come with a shell catcher gizmo that holds the shell for you so you don't have to crab around the field for your discards.

title: For Sale:  AR-15 -> quad rail, free float handguard, bull barrel, BUIS
location: Durham, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
I bought this in 2009 and just haven't put more than a hundred rounds through it.  I bought it from a friend who builds rifles "for fun" (yeah, he's single, how did you know?) - he puts stuff together, fires a few hundred rounds through the rifles, and then tries something else.  Most of this rifle was from new stock but there are parts (the carrier) that were from his piles.  The AR is a great platform that way. 

It's a great gun, and way more accurate than I am a shooter, but I have three active kids and just no time to shoot.  Heck, I haven't even been deer hunting this year.

I'm cleaning out my gun room, so no trades, just cash.  I'll entertain reasonable offers, and will sell the gun without the BUIS for $700.

If you buy the gun, I'll sell you my ammo (about 1,500 rounds) for 10% less than you can find it anywhere on the net.

The lower is from Essential Arms (model A2) and the upper is from Model 1 (model A3).  The barrel has a 1/9 twist.  The handguard is free float (obviously).  The bull barrel is 20".

If you are local and have a CCL or a pistol permit we can do this face to face.  If you are local and don't have a CCL/permit we will do it through an FFL.  I will ship to your FFL (at your cost) if they'll hold the gun until I get cash.

title: For Sale:  Cactus Vick's Great Western 357 Atomic Revolver 7 1/2"
postcontent:
I you remember "Cactus Vick" from you childhood, this is one of his revolvers. He carried this Great Western and a Colt designed exactly the same way. This gun had a blued barrel and frame, a "gold" cylinder and hammer and nickel grip-frame and ejector housing. It would have been striking on those television shows and birthday parties.

The finish of the revolver is worn from constant holster use, however, the action is very tight and I doubt that the gun was ever shot more than a very few times, if ever.

Cactus Vick was a childrens' show host on KARK in the fifties and sixties. He was sponsored by Wonder Bread and towed a small carousel to childrens' birthday parties. Own a part of your childhood history. The ownership is documented and some photos are part of the package. The Gun itself is rare, Being Cactus Vick's makes if 1 of 2. Thank you for your attention

History

In 1899, the Army and Navy placed orders with Smith and Wesson for two to three thousand Model 1889 Hand Ejector revolvers chambered for the M1892 .38 U.S. Service Cartridge (aka .38 Long Colt). With this order, the Hand Ejector Model 1889 became known as the .38 Military and Police model of 1899.[3] That same year, in response to reports from military sources serving in the Philippines on the relative ineffectiveness of the .38 (Long Colt) cartridge, Smith & Wesson began offering the Military & Police in a new chambering, the .38 S&W Special (aka .38 Special)  a slightly elongated version of the .38 Long Colt cartridge with increased bullet weight (158 grains) and increase in powder charge from eighteen to twenty-one grains of black powder.[4]

postcontent:
I purchased this rifle brand new in the box in October for a November Deer Hunt. Deer season is over and christmas is rapidly approaching and my finances are not doing so well. Bluntly put the company I work for is not giving out a christmas bonus this year (first time in 12 years) and I need money for christmas presents for my kids. I hate to sell it as this rifle is one accurate deer slaying machine, but it's keep the rifle and the kids don't get a christmas, or sell it now so the kids can still believe in santa...

Its a Thompson Venture bolt-action in the 25-06 caliber. I have a Nikon Prostaff 3-9x40 scope with the Bullet Drop Compensator (BDC) reticle mounted to it. Additionally it has a padded nylon web bone collector sling and also a padded bone collector soft carrying case. Also included is the thompson Bolt cable and lock for securing it (+2 keys).

I am prior military and take pride in a clean weapon so you can bet this rifle is kept immaculate. 16 shots is all thats been through it and I still have the remaining 4 Hornday Superformance 85gr rounds from the one and only box I initially purchased for sighting in the scope and deer season, if you want them. (15 rounds to sight it in and have some fun + 1 round for the buck I shot = 4 shells left)

I have a total of 685$ in it. 450$ for the rifle. 175$ for the scope. 25$ for the sling and 35$ for the case. Since it is now considered used I understand that means I can't sell it for what I bought it all for, so I am knocking the price down. I have until December 13th to sell this or christmas is a bust this year so if your interested I can be reached at the below email:

title: For Sale/Trade:  BELGUIN Browning A-5, 12 Ga Shotgun.
postcontent:
This is a real classic, Belgiun Browning, 12 ga auto loading shotgun.  It is in EXCELLET condition and truly stunning.  The walnut stock has beautiful grain.  The metal is finley blued and polished.  Engraving is crisp and clear.  This is a very clean piece...  superb craftsmanship, well cared for.  Barrel is 28" with vent rib, modified choke. 
   These pics just can't capture its beauty.  Must see to appreciate.  
   The A-5 (Auto 5) was manufactured for nearly 100 years, but is no longer made.  It has been loved for generations of hunters and collectors.  
   The designer, John Browning, designed many guns and held patents on 128 of them.  These included the Colt 1911, Browning Hi Power, BAR, M2 50 cal machine gun, and many, many more.  Of all of these, he said the A-5 shotgun was his best effort. 
   Note: I originally thought this was a Japan made Browning, but ONLY the barrel is.  The rest is Belgiun, pre-1967, with round pistol grip bottom.  Likely, the Japan made barrel was put on this Belgiun gun to allow safe use of steel shot for waterfoul.  It is rated for this, and fine to use with steel shot.  Most Belgiun barrels are NOT.  
   I do have access to a vent rib Belgiun barrel in exchange for the Japan one (free).  Let me know, if interested.
   This is your chance to own a first class peice of American history, (one you can use).  You'll be proud to own it, and pass it down to your grandson.

location: St. Louis, St. Charles, JEFCO Missouri, St. Louis, Missouri
postcontent:
Defensor Firearms & Protection Training, LLC

(Defensor CCW)


Next scheduled class is July 22nd

PRICING:

$90 Per person with free .22lr semi-auto or revolver rental. You must provide at least one handgun of your own, we will provide the other. (you must provide ammo for both.

$80 Per person for couples and families. (couples can share firearms)

$70 For LE, Military and First responders

$10 Rental charge for both handguns if you do not own either. (limited supplies so try to bring at least one or the other)

$25 Deposit holds your spot

Note:
There will also be some CCW related products on display and for sale so having some extra cash or checks on hand may be convenient. Also we are licensed firearms dealers (FFL) so if your interested in any specific firearm or accessory please let us know after you register for the class. Registered students receive a 10% discount.



CLASS INFO:

State of Missouri requires classes to be 8hr min. and for students to qualify with both semi-auto pistol and revolver firing 70rds each. 
(50rds practice/20 rds qualify

Class begins at 8:00 am and will run to approximately 4:00 pm. There will be a 15 min break at 10am and lunch will be at 12pm for 1 hr.
(restaurants for lunch are 10-15mins away up hwy 94)

Classroom instruction will be in the morning and qualification on the range will be in the afternoon.

Classroom is in an air conditioned professional facility. There are indoor mens and womens restrooms, microwave and refrigerator for you to use. (if you bring your lunch)

The Outdoor Shooting range is shaded is in the same location just outside the classroom door. (we can shoot rain or shine)



INSTRUCTORS:

We are current NRA certified instructors, Range safety officers, Active Law Enforcement and Military. There will be a Min. of two instructors per scheduled class.



LOCATION:

Weldon Springs, Mo. (near bush wildlife). 10min west of Chesterfield Valley



WHAT TO BRING:

Bring at least 150rds per person to practice and qualify with.

Eye and Ear protection. (This is madatory, do not forget!)

pen or pencil.

refreshments (especially for the outdoor qualification)

weather appropriate attire (you know the Missouri summers) 



HOW TO REGISTER:

Email me at REDACTED or reply to this post and Tell me the following:

-what class date you would like to attend
-how many will be in your group
-what equipment you will need to rent
-what county you reside in (IE: St.Louis County, St.Charles County, Ect. Ect.) 
-we will then set up payment for your deposit.


We look forward to seeing you!

Also check us out on the web at www.defensorccw.com

title: For Sale/Trade:  Extrema Ratio Harpoon
postcontent:
Authentic, Italian made Harpoon knife manufactured by Extrema Ratio of Prato, Italy.  I purchased this knife new, about eight years ago, while stationed in Italy.  This knife accompanied me when my brigade parachuted into northern Iraq in March of 2003 and spent my first tour serving me well. It later deployed with me, to Afghanistan in 2005. It has obvious wear marks along the blade, mostly from dust inside the scabbard and actual use, but it is otherwise in excellent condition.

This knife is no longer in production at Extrema Ratio and was one of their first product lines several year ago.  It is an agressive design, best suited for fighting and intimidation.  Extrema Ratio is one of the premier knife makers in Italy, with several contracts with Italian and European militaries for knives.

 Overall length is about 13.5 inches, with the blade comprising 8.5 inches; the handle 5.  Knife is surprisingly light for a large-bladed weapon and handles very well.

  Knife comes with its original scabbard, which can be configured for a drop-leg set-up.  Scabbard features positive retention, along with a ruggedized "velcro"-type material on the knife handle which meshes with the retention snaps on the scabbard for absolute positive retention.

  It pains me to part with this knife, due to sentimental reasons, but times are hard and I could use the cash.  I originally paid 250 Euros for this knife and feel the asking price of $150 is more than fair, especially considering the knife's combat history.

  Will accept cash or money orders.  More pictures available upon request.

title: For Sale:  Browning Bar 30-06 Nikon Prostaff 3-9
location: Durham, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
I bought this gun from a guy who kept it in his closet as a self defense weapon.  I guess if you think large North American animals are going to break into your house that makes sense.  I'd hate to live next door to him tho!

This is a made-in-Belgium by FN and assembled-in-Portugal Browning BAR in 30-06 with class-1 wood upgrade.  (I'm not sure the pictures do the wood justice.)  It has a Nikon Pro-staff 3-9 riflescope on it.  I'm not a very good shot and can put three bullets into a 2" circle at 200 yards.  Which probably means the gun is way more accurate than that.

The gun is in 99.9% condition.  I'm sure there is something wrong with it, but I don't see it.  It has never been taken into the field.  I loved this gun but couldn't see it in a tree stand.  The guy I bought it from shot four rounds out of it - I know this because he shipped me his two partially used ammo.  I've still got the boxes left so we're still under 40 rounds lifetime.

Of all the guns I'm selling this is hardest - it was the first long gun I bought as an adult.   I am cleaning out my gunroom and selling stuff I don't fire, so I will entertain reasonable offers, but cash only, no trades. I am not trying to just move the pieces around.

If you are local and have a CCL or a pistol permit we can do this face to face. If you are local and don't have a CCL/permit we will do it through an FFL. I will ship to your FFL (at your cost) if they'll hold the gun until I get cash.

title: For Sale:  Kimber Stainless Ultra TLE II LG Crimson Trace 45 1911
location: Denver, Colo Springs and Pueblo, Colorado, United States
postcontent:
Kimber Stainless Ultra TLE II LG Night Sights and Crimson Trace 45 1911 

All Kimber pistols in centerfire calibers have a Loaded Chamber Indicator Port. When a round is chambered and light is available, the shell casing should be visible through the slot at the rear of the barrel hood. All slides and frames are paired in the early stages of production and travel through the factory together, ensuring optimum fitting of every part. This is one reason Kimber pistols have unequaled performance and dependability. 

Custom features like high ride beavertail grip safety, extended thumb safety and Commander-style hammer are part of every Kimber pistol. All parts are made inside the Kimber factory, ensuring quality control. 

The Kimber Custom sets the performance standard for production 1911 pistols. 
Models are offered with a choice of fixed, adjustable or night sights, and in 
matte or polished finishes. Both carbon steel and stainless steel versions are available. Common features include the Kimber Firing Pin Safety, designated by II in the model name, along with rounded and blended edges for comfortable carry. Barrels, barrel bushings, chambers and triggers are all machined to exacting match grade dimensions. Ejection ports are lowered and flared, and sights are mounted in dovetails machined into the slide. Chamberings include .45 ACP, 9mm, 10mm and 38 Super.

title: For Sale:  Smith carbine cavalry model .52 cal
postcontent:
By the serial # 208** this firearm was built in 1863, and has military inspectors proof stamp, "CSL" on left side of barrel. This piece could have possibly been issued to a member of either the 7th or 11th Illinois Cavalry, original bearers initials are carved in butt stock. I have attempted to study in to it, but have not yet found the correct muster list. 
 The original hammer and barrel band, were missing, I cleaned up this carbine and replaced them. And I have returned it to a functional piece of Civil War history.
 It has 3 land and 3 groove rifling. I have a couple handfuls of reloadable cartridges(about 40), are made of a plastic material, and one brass one, and a Rapine .520 Smith Carbine bullet mould that comes with it, that I purchased from DGW. Uses musket caps.

I will except any reasonable cash offers, and entertain possible barters and partial trades

title: For Sale/Trade:  CZ-85 9mm Czech Police 1991 VG 1 Mag CZ85 CZ model 85 Ceska Zbrojovka
postcontent: This listing is for One Pistol. FFLs and Law Enforcement Agencies, however, may take any number of additional CZ-85s at the same per-pistol price, and with no additional shipping charges. From the early days of a free Czech Republic, here is a specimen of Czech gunsmithys handiwork, their CZ-85 pistol. CZ ruled the Wonder Nine days of the 1970s and 1980s, as far as steel frame pistols went. Czech engineers took John M. Brownings 1935 Hi-Power design, strengthened it, and developed a smooth and accurate masterpiece in double action. Their CZ-85 has ambidextrous safety, ambidextrous slide stop, full chrome barrel, serrated trigger guard, and overtravel stop on the back of its trigger. Photos show 5 different specimens from the issue weapons of the Municipal Police of Ostrava, Czech Republic, where this pistol protected a flourishing population in their industrious city. Year code is stamped above the extractor, 1991. The CZ-85 is a traditional double- and single action auto with a main safety that allows cocked-and-locked carry. This pistol does not have a firing pin block or safety, so its single action trigger pull is crisper than most. The .227 wide serrated spur hammer has a half cock position for safety-off double action carry. Slide is serrated rear for easy operation; and its 4.7 inch barrel with double cam slide lock matches its Browning ancestor. Chrome finished smooth face .315 combat trigger yields a smooth, consistent double action trigger pull of 7/8 inch distance; single action trigger travel measures about 1/3 inch with minimal felt creep. Specimens we have gauged pull at 4 pound vicinity on single action. Sights are stake-on serrated ramp front with dovetailed, well protected dot configuration rear fixed sight both mounted on a heat-dissipating serrated rib atop the slide.  Construction is entirely steel, with a semi-gloss black Polycoat finish similar to the Mark II Browning Hi-Powers. Grips are issue CZ logo black polymer. Ease of disassembly and reassembly exceeds all other pistols on the market even today, with hash marks on the disassembly position for easy removal of the slide stop / barrel link pin; disassembly yields grip frame, barrel, guide rod and spring. Weight empty is 35 ounces. Surface detractions on this pistol is only moderate, edge whitening and moderate contact surface wear to the grip frame backstrap and moderate toning to the white steel barrel surface. We classify it as Very Good, 80 percent vicinity; photos should suffice for our distinguished shoppers to check our grading, the pistol buyer will receive will be substantially identical and from the same Department trade. Left side of slide is marked with the importers stamp, PW Arms Redmond WA, as required by US Law; and then the CZ logo and Model 85 cal. 9 Luger, with Made in Czechoslovakia on the left side of the frame. These fine pistols are well maintained by their Ostrava officers; and they are excellent mechanically; bore, chamber, and mechanism are all bright, clean, and excellent. The CZ 85 pistols will digest any ammunition, from lead bullet reloads to steel case Russian to the finest Federal Hydra-Shok sharp-nosed hollowpoints. That is something one cannot say about competitors Glock and HK, to name a couple. Another strong suite is their slides mate precisely to the frames, full steel-rail-to-steel-rail contact, not with a slide resting on four small runners like their Austrian competitors. This is a real pistol, not a piece of plastic. It comes with an original issue steel 15 shot magazine, and in a factory box. Willing to meet at a halfway point for trade, and can go + with cash to balance out, depending of course, on trade value.  

If selling for cash, we will have to meet in the Trinidad area.

Respects,

Richard

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sig 9mm P228 Swiss Police 14 Shot 2 Mags Siglite
postcontent:
Sig 9mm P228 Swiss Police 14 Shot 2005 VG-Exc  2 Magazines Night Sights K Kote All German Sig Sauer P-228 CA OK Solothurn Shield, Here is an eminently serviceable, attractive specimen of the original Sig Sauer Compact, the P228 chambered in 9mm: 9mm Parabellum, 9mm Luger, call it what you will; The 9mm. This weapon served and protected our Swiss friends in the Northwest Region of their country, Canton Solothurn, with that subdivisions counterpart to our State Police. The Solothurn Shield is neatly engraved atop the slide near the rear sights. This 228 is not date coded, but from its B330000 range serial number, it was manufactured in 2005. It is thoroughly German, and serialized on its frame, slide, and barrel. Its only U.S. marking is PW Arms import stamp on the right side of the slide, as the photos show.  This is standard traditional double action: from a resting hammer, a long double action pull on the first shot, and then single action until the shooter engages the decocker. This pistol, like all modern Sigs, has a firing pin safety. What the factory says, emphasizes what we know of the worlds best brand of pistol: A single action or double action pistol, the P228 has a magazine capacity of 13 rounds. It has the automatic firing pin safety system used on previous Sig Sauer pistols, and the magazine catch can be mounted on the left or right side to suit the operator's preference. The magazine floorplate, made of high impact synthetics, gives the magazine a considerable degree of protection against damage caused by dropping. An essentially closed design concept renders the P228 particularly resistant to dust and dirt. Here is what we say: the 228 and its 229 counterpart are the best quality 9mm Compact pistols on the market, emphasis on best more than on Compact. They are the smallest variant double-stacked magazine capable descendants of the definitive P226, the P-228 with semi-gloss K-Kote finish slide and matching lightweight alloy frame. Barrel is 3.9 inches 6 groove 1:10 rifling; weight empty is 26.1 oz; length 6.9 inches; height 5 1/4 inches; maximum width 1.5 inches; 5.5 inch sight radius; 10 pound double action trigger pull; and Sig's classic crisp single action pull at 4 1/2 pound vicinity, with negligible felt creep. Capacity is 13+1 rounds, and we are furnishing this pistol with two factory 13 Round 228 Magazines. Sights are orginal Factory Night Sights, and we rate their luminosity at 60 percent of original strength from our darkroom inspection. Finish is highly durable K Kote, so Surface detractions are minimal, with faint small amounts of white along some of the upper slide edges. Grips are original issue, with moderate toning to the grip screws. We rate it as Very Good, close to Excellent, 85 percent vicinity by our estimate. Photos, at any rate, ought to suffice for our distinguished shoppers to judge finish grade for themselves. It is certainly Excellent mechanically; the Swiss Police are among the best worldwide for weapons maintenance. It comes in a hard case with Cable Lock, and Factory German / French Instruction Manual. Replacement price on these in our area, if a person can even find one, is upwards of $1,000.00. We're offering the exact Sig P228 in the photos	for only	$ 569.00.		Not transferable to civilian residents of Massachusetts. For civilian buyers in other jurisdictions where 13 round magazines are restricted to law enforcement, $15 off with no magazine or $10 extra with a subbed Mec-Gar 10 Shot Magazine. title: For Sale/Trade:  Sig 9mm P228 Swiss Police 14 Shot 1 Mag Siglite
postcontent: Sig 9mm P228 Swiss Police Solothurn Shield 14 Shot  1 Magazine 1991 All German Sig Sauer P-228 CA OK, Here is an eminently serviceable, attractive specimen of the original Sig Sauer Compact, the P228 chambered in 9mm: 9mm Parabellum, 9mm Luger, call it what you will; The 9mm. This weapon served and protected our Swiss friends in the Northwest Region of their country, Canton Solothurn, with that subdivisions counterpart to our State Police. The Solothurn Shield adorns the forward left side of the slide on this specimen. From its KB Date Code, it was manufactured in 1991; and this pistol is thoroughly German, and serialized on its frame, slide, and barrel. Its only U.S. marking is PW Arms import stamp on the right side of the slide, as the photos show.  This is standard traditional double action: from a resting hammer, a long double action pull on the first shot, and then single action until the shooter engages the decocker. This pistol, like all modern Sigs, has a firing pin safety. What the factory says, emphasizes what we know of the worlds best brand of pistol: A single action or double action pistol, the P228 has a magazine capacity of 13 rounds. It has the automatic firing pin safety system used on previous Sig Sauer pistols, and the magazine catch can be mounted on the left or right side to suit the operator's preference. The magazine floorplate, made of high impact synthetics, gives the magazine a considerable degree of protection against damage caused by dropping. An essentially closed design concept renders the P228 particularly resistant to dust and dirt. Here is what we say: the 228 and its 229 counterpart are the best quality 9mm Compact pistols on the market, emphasis on best more than on Compact. They are the smallest variant double-stacked magazine capable descendants of the definitive P226, the P-228 with matte blue slide, and matte anodized lightweight alloy frame. Barrel is 3.9 inches 6 groove 1:10 rifling; weight empty is 26.1 oz; length 6.9 inches; height 5 1/4 inches; maximum width 1.5 inches; 5.5 inch sight radius; 10 pound double action trigger pull; and Sig's classic crisp single action pull at 4 1/2 pound vicinity, with negligible felt creep. Capacity is 13+1 rounds, and this pistol is furnished with one original Swiss Police issue 13 round Sig factory magazine. Sights are issue 3 dot configuration, night sights but with only faint remaining luminosity. Surface detractions come from holster contact, principally on the slide area with moderate to extensive surface whitening. Grips are Police issue, as the photos show, with moderate to extensive scouring mostly on the right panel and back area, with moderate toning or whitening to the grip screws. We rate it as Good, perhaps Very Good, 75 percent vicinity by our estimate. Photos, at any rate, ought to suffice for our distinguished shoppers to judge finish grade for themselves. It is certainly Excellent mechanically; the Swiss Police are among the best worldwide for weapons maintenance. Replacement price on these in our area, if a person can even find one, is upwards of $1,000.00. We're offering the exact Sig P228 in the photos	for only	$ 469.00.		Transferable to civilians in all jurisdictions of the United States. For civilian buyers in jurisdictions where 13 round magazines are restricted to law enforcement, $15 off with no magazine or $10 extra with a subbed Mec-Gar 10 Shot Magazine. Affected jurisdictions include California, Chicago, D.C., Hawaii, Massachusetts, New York, and Puerto Rico. Thank you for looking, please email me if interested.

Keith
